wiki.content:
This is the first section of Steve Reich's "Music for 18 Musicians" from 1976.

wiki.summary: This is the first section of Steve Reich's "Music for 18 Musicians" from 1976.

track.name: Pulses
comments: love the vocals
nope, reece_slim.
I think the term 'minimalism' is a bit of an insult to this guy's work, don't you think?
One of my favorite pieces ever. I think it's my most listened to song while studying and while driving.
cheese sandwich.
enlightenment
vibrational!
purity.
those bass clarinet washes are swoonsome
@kaziorvb Actually, it's not. Every source I've seen lists both as "Pulses." THat's why it only has 200 listeners on last.fm.
There isn't much out there that compares to Music For 18 Musicians
Music for 18 musicians is incredible.

well, actually this song doesn't really appear on the album twice, the other 'Pulses' is often named 'Pulses II' and it's a different track. the first 'Pulses' stands for an intro and the other 'Pulses II' is an outro.
Absolutely love it.
No offense inteded :)
MMBKG is going to be an agony aunt/uncle when he grows up

@KosmischeSynth: Music for 18 Musicians. @be_quiet_peter: this piece appears twice on the disc. @LondonLouis: this is just the first and last section, do yourself a favor and check out the whole piece.
what is this from? whatever it is, im buying the album.
I definitely haven't listened to this track as many times as last.fm now tells me. What the fuck is wrong with this site?

life enhancing recognition of the continuous dynamic beat of our endless quest for enlightenment and knowledge that we are programmed to keep on searching for with continuous energy
and determination to succeed regardless of all obstacles and challenges let us celebrate this magical and ysterious cosmic energy that is sent down to us for the distant past
